etymology.description: 點(點) (diǎn, "dot; point") + 茶(茶) (chá, "tea") = a method of preparing tea by whisking it into a frothy mixture.
etymology.interpretation: 點茶(點茶) (diǎn chá, "traditional tea whisking method") refers to an ancient method of preparing tea where finely powdered tea is whisked with hot water, creating a frothy beverage. This method was particularly popular during the Song Dynasty and laid the groundwork for the Japanese tea ceremony.

examples.chinese: 点茶是一种古老而优雅的茶艺(點茶是一種古老而優雅的茶藝)。
examples.pinyin: diǎn chá shì yī zhǒng gǔlǎo ér yōuyǎ de cháyì.
examples.english: Tea whisking is an ancient and elegant tea art.

examples.chinese: 在茶馆里(在茶館裡)，人们常常欣赏点茶表演(人們常常欣賞點茶表演)。
examples.pinyin: zài cháguǎn lǐ, rénmen chángcháng xīnshǎng diǎn chá biǎoyǎn.
examples.english: In tea houses, people often enjoy watching tea whisking performances.

examples.chinese: 点茶不仅传承文化(點茶不僅傳承文化)，更展现了独特魅力(更展現了獨特魅力)。
examples.pinyin: diǎn chá bù jǐn chuánchéng wénhuà, gèng zhǎnxiànle dútè mèilì.
examples.english: Tea whisking not only preserves cultural heritage, but also exhibits its unique charm.
